name: Tibetan Music
description: Traditional and modern music of the Tibetan peoples, mainly produced in Tibet and also practiced in Bhutan, Nepal, and northern India, and influential on the traditions of Burma.

children.name: Chöd
children.description: Tibetan Buddhist and Bönpo practice incorporating ritualized liturgical chants and instrumental accompaniment from the chöd damaru, drilbu, and kangling.

children.name: Tibetan Buddhist Chant
children.description: Ritual vocal music of the Tibetan Buddhist faith characterized by its low pitch, droning repetitiousness, and frequent use of overtone singing.

children.name: Zhabdro gorgom
children.description: Lively, rhythmic and informal Bhutanese folk music of Tibetan origin.
